definition: Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: He then decides to find out what that scooter really is and slams on his brakes.
sentences.chinese: 他想看看到底这个人是怎么回事，他就来了个急刹车。

sentences.english: This made the driver following her brake hard.
sentences.chinese: 她这一停使得跟在后头的司机也来了个急刹车。

sentences.english: Slamming on the brakes and accelerating too quickly can reduce fuel efficiency up to 33 percent.
sentences.chinese: 急刹车和急速加速都会降低燃料效率达33%。

sentences.english: A sudden braking tumbled him down.
Bonnie a brake, and then open the skylight, the sea monster thrown out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 邦妮一个急刹车，然后打开天窗，海妖甩出到车外。

sentences.english: Giant shock, hastens to slam the brakes again, looked back and the woman has emerged.
sentences.chinese: 巨惊，赶忙又急刹车，回头一看，那女人又出现了。

sentences.english: Avoid slamming the brakes on, changing lane and swerving hurriedly, or it will stop suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 避免急刹车，急换道，急转弯，否者会突然停止。

sentences.english: But this is an honest-to-goodness slam on the brakes.
sentences.chinese: 但是这是一个实实在在的“急刹车”。

sentences.english: From around the car, mobile phones start to ring。
sentences.chinese: 在地铁急刹车时，车厢内各个角落的手机开始响起来。

definition: to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
to turn/to go around a corner
to stop/to come to a halt
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to reduce speed/to slow down/to take it easy
to tailgate/to hit the car in front as a result of tailgating
